When her father dies unexpectedly, Shannon is left to run the family farm on her own. She quickly discovers that she is in over her head and the farm is in danger of being foreclosed on. Shannon decides to take a risk and hire a team of migrant workers to help her save the farm. The workers are hard-working and Shannon soon finds herself developing feelings for one of them, Diego. However, she knows that it would be inappropriate to pursue a relationship with someone she is employer. Shannon and Diego must find a way to resist their feelings for each other and focus on saving the farm. As the harvest season approaches, Shannon and her team are in a race against the clock to get the crops in. At the same time, Shannon is struggling to keep her feelings for Diego in check. With everything on the line, Shannon has to decide what is more important: her relationship with Diego or the farm.

completion:

They both laugh and Shannon leans her head against her father's shoulder.

I know your mother would be proud of you too.

SHANNON

I miss her.

FARMER BROWN

I know, sweetheart. I miss her too.

They stand there in silence for a moment, both lost in their own thoughts.

FARMER BROWN

Well, I should get to the fields.

SHANNON

Okay. I'll see you later.

FARMER BROWN

Shannon?

SHANNON

Yes?

FARMER BROWN

I love you.

SHANNON

I love you too, Daddy.

FARMER BROWN

Diego!

Diego, a young migrant worker, comes running over.

FARMER BROWN

Can you give Shannon a hand with the irrigation system?

DIEGO

Sure thing, boss.

FARMER BROWN

Thanks, Diego.

Diego and Shannon walk off in the opposite direction.

DIEGO

Mexico. I came here with my family a few years ago.

DIEGO

It's not easy, but I'm grateful for the opportunity to work.

SHANNON

My father always said that the hardest workers are the ones who appreciate what they have.

DIEGO

Your father is a wise man.

SHANNON

He is.

Diego and Shannon continue to talk as they walk to the irrigation system. They soon reach it and start to work.

So, Diego, have you ever been in love?

DIEGO

SHANNON

Diego and Shannon continue to talk as they work. They soon finish and start to walk back to the farmhouse.

I should get inside. My father will be wondering where I am.

It was nice talking to you, Diego.

DIEGO

You too, Shannon.

They both smile and go their separate ways.

prompt:
When local librarian and book club host ML Turner is found dead in her home, the small town of Jasper Falls is in shock. No one can imagine who would want to hurt ML, but as the police begin their investigation, it becomes clear that she was not as well liked as everyone thought. As the townspeople start to point fingers, amateur sleuth Nadine Hunter sets out to find the killer herself. With the help of her book club friends, Nadine starts to piece together a motive for murder. But just as she seems to be getting close to the truth, the killer strikes again. Nadine is in a race against time to solve the murders and catch the killer before anyone else gets hurt. But with everyone in town a suspect, she'll have to tread carefully or she could end up being the killer's next victim.

We see the body of ML Turner, lying on the floor in a pool of blood. There is a large gash in her head.

The camera pans around the room, taking in the scene of the crime.

We see Nadine Hunter being interviewed by the police.

NADINE

I just can't believe it. ML was such a kind, gentle person.

The police officer gives Nadine a sympathetic look before leaving the room.

Nadine is clearly shaken by the events.

NADINE

Jason puts his arms around Nadine, comforting her.

Jason looks at Nadine, surprised.

NADINE

NADINE

After inheriting her Aunt Harriet's old Victorian house, amateur sleuth Penelope Peters finds herself in the middle of a mystery when Harriet's former neighbor is found dead in her own home. Although the police rule the death a natural causes, Penelope is not convinced. With the help of her new friends, Penelope sets out to uncover the truth and ends up uncovering a much more complicated mystery than she ever could have imagined.

completion:
FADE IN:

EXT. VICTORIAN HOUSE - DAY

We see a beautiful old Victorian house. It is surrounded by a white picket fence and has a large porch with a swing. We hear the sound of a car pulling up.

PENELOPE (voice-over): This is the house my Aunt Harriet left me. I'd never even met her. But when she died, she left me this house.

We see a young woman, PENELOPE PETERS, getting out of a car. She is in her early twenties and is very pretty. She is carrying a suitcase.

PENELOPE (voice-over): I came here to see what I had inherited. I had no idea what I was getting myself into.

Penelope walks up to the house and unlocks the door. She steps inside.

PENELOPE (voice-over): The first thing I noticed was the smell. It was musty and old. But it was also kind of...pleasant.

Penelope looks around the house. It is very old and dusty, but it is also very beautiful.

PENELOPE (voice-over): I could tell that the house had been empty for a long time. But there was something about it that made me feel at home.

Penelope starts to explore the house. She goes into the living room and looks around. Then she notices a picture on the wall. It is a picture of a woman who looks a lot like her.

PENELOPE: This must be Aunt Harriet.

Penelope looks at the picture for a moment, then she hears a noise coming from upstairs. She goes to investigate.

PENELOPE (voice-over): I didn't know what to expect when I came here. But I definitely didn't expect to find a dead body.

We see Penelope walking up the stairs. She is holding her suitcase in one hand and the picture in the other. She looks scared.

PENELOPE (voice-over): The body was of a woman. She was old and she was wearing a nightgown. I didn't know who she was. But I knew I had to call the police.

Penelope goes into the room where the body is and puts down her suitcase. She takes out her phone and starts to dial 911.
